com.gopivotal.pig

Class HawqLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.pig.LoadFunc
      • com.gopivotal.pig.HawqLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.pig.LoadMetadata

    public class HawqLoader
extends org.apache.pig.LoadFunc
implements org.apache.pig.LoadMetadata
    The HawqLoader class wraps the HAWQInputFormat. It converts HAWQRecord objects into Tuples for Pig to process. The HawqLoader will automatically convert the HAWQ table definition to a Pig schema. Details on what data types map to which fields are below. Arrays are not currently supported.

    First and foremost, users must disable Pig's split combination optimizer. This restriction will be lifted in the future. You do this by adding "SET pig.splitCombination false;" at the top of your Pig script or when you enter the grunt shell.

    The HawqLoader path is "hawq://:<port>/<database>".

    The HawqLoader has three parameters. The table name (required) and then the username and password (optional).

    An example is below. You can, of course, use command line parameters for any of the options as well as the location string.

     SET pig.splitCombination false;
 A = LOAD 'hawq://mdw1:5432/gpadmin' USING com.gopivotal.pig.HawqLoader('retail_demo.products_dim', 'gpadmin');
 DESCRIBE A;
 A: {product_id: int,category_id: int,price: bigdecimal,product_name: chararray}
 B = LOAD 'hawq://mdw1:5432/gpadmin' USING com.gopivotal.pig.HawqLoader('retail_demo.vinyl_counts', 'gpadmin');
 DESCRIBE B;
 B: {category_id: int,count: int}
 C = JOIN A BY category_id, B by category_id USING 'replicated';
 STORE C INTO '$output';
    Below is a table describing the mappings from HAWQ to Java to Pig types.

    HAWQ Type Java Type Pig Type
    BIT HAWQVarbit byte
    BOOL boolean boolean
    BOX HAWQBox tuple({pt1: (x: double,y: double),pt2: (x: double,y: double)})
    BPCHAR String chararray
    BYTEA byte[] bytearray
    CHAR char chararray
    CIDR HAWQCidr chararray
    CIRCLE HAWQCircle tuple({x: double,y: double,r: double})
    DATE java.sql.Date datetime (via org.joda.time.DateTime)
    float4 float float
    float8 double double
    INET HAWQInet chararray
    INT2 short integer
    INT4 int integer
    INT8 long long
    INTERVAL HAWQInterval chararray
    LSEG HAWQLseg tuple({pt1: (x: double,y: double),pt2: (x: double,y: double)})
    MACADDR HAWQMacaddr chararray
    NUMERIC java.math.BigDecimal bigdecimal
    PATH HAWQPath tuple({open: boolean,pts: {x: double,y: double}})
    POINT HAWQPoint tuple({x: double,y: double})
    POLYGON HAWQPolygon tuple({pts: {x: double,y: double},bbox: (pt1: (x: double,y: double),pt2: (x: double,y: double))})
    TEXT String chararray
    TIME java.sql.Time datetime
    TIMESTAMP java.sql.Timestamp datetime
    TIMESTAMPZ java.sql.Timestamp datetime
    TIMETZ java.sql.Time datetime
    VARBIT HAWQVarbit bytearray
    VARCHAR String chararray
    XML String chararray
